author: Staff Reporter
text:
The State government on Monday sought two more weeks to take a decision on revising the autorickshaw fare in accordance with the variation in the fuel price.

Additional Advocate General Arvindh Pandian made a mention before the First Bench of Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice Pushpa Sathyanarayana, as the matter is posted for hearing on Tuesday. However, no directions were made on the request made by the State government till the closing bell in the evening.

During a recent hearing, the High Court directed the government to revise the rates in accordance with the fuel price and take measures to implement the same expeditiously along with the eight other guidelines framed on a PIL moved by Coimbatore Consumer Voice.

The court warned that if the guidelines are not implemented, the court would consider appointing a Court Commissioner to verify the situation at the ground level.
title: State seeks more time to revise autorickshaw fare
